text:
Nice old-school mall with 1980s vibes - the entire mall is air conditioned inside. Roxy Square kopitiam has a variety of food outlets including the famous Katong laksa.

For antique and paper money & coin collectors, stop by Dong Hai Trading on level 1 - there is a display of various world paper money on the shop window and more selections inside.

My fav black sauce wantanmee by the shouting number uncle. Such a nice man but he's old now and forgetful. Such a sweet old man. Wife and son cooking. He just collects money these days and sells nasi lemak too

For nostalgic reason n feel... Mall is old n vintage, separate into square 1 n 2... Many manicure pedicure/ hair salons/ children enrichment/ maids agency/ vintage old store selling vintage stuffs... A different feel from those homogeneous mall that pop up in every neighborhood, somehow... Maybe should "look deep" to find "something treasure", maybe... There is a old vinyl store selling old vinyl, 80's stuff, cool...

Roxy Square is a decent shopping center with a good mix of stores and restaurants. The parking lot is spacious and easy to navigate, and there are plenty of entrances to the mall. The interior of the mall is clean and well-maintained, with ample seating areas for shoppers to rest. The stores themselves are varied, ranging from clothing and accessories to electronics and home goods. There are also several dining options, including fast food chains and sit-down restaurants. Overall, Roxy Square is a convenient and pleasant place to shop, but it doesn't necessarily stand out as a must-visit destination.

Clean, easy to read signs, maps to show where the different MRT runs. And they also have at the control room where you can get information. Make sure you check what the last Train is so you don't miss it if you are out late.
